item.title: 东京力邀亚洲初创企业，力求重振IPO市场
item.description: 东京证券交易所正致力于强化其首次公开募股市场，力图成为亚洲初创企业跨境上市的首选平台。【原文：Tokyo Stock Exchange Inc. is looking to strengthen its market for initial public offerings by pitching itself as a venue for cross-border listings by startups in Asia.】

item.title: 韩国KOSPI指数突破5000点，人工智能需求推动市场飙升
item.description: 韩国股市基准指数突破5000点关口，达到总统李在明设定的目标，人工智能驱动的需求正推动科技股占主导地位的市场。【原文：South Korea’s stock benchmark advanced to cross the 5,000 target set by President Lee Jae Myung, as AI‑driven demand powers the tech‑heavy market.】

item.title: 令吉交易信号显示全球对马来西亚信心增强
item.description: 随着全球投资者将资金涌入马来西亚，押注该国货币的强劲涨势仍有空间，马来西亚林吉特正迎来数年来的最活跃交易期。【原文：The Malaysian ringgit is riding its most active trading period in years as global investors pour capital into the country, wagering that its market-beating rally has room to run.】

item.title: 尽管与中国的争端持续，日本出口已连续第四个月增长
item.description: 日本出口连续第四个月增长，尽管两国外交争端持续，但中国市场需求保持稳定。【原文：Japan’s exports rose for a fourth consecutive month as demand in China held steady despite an ongoing diplomatic dispute.】

item.title: 拉丁美洲借助中国之力挺过特朗普的贸易风暴
item.description: 去年特朗普总统的关税政策颠覆全球贸易格局时，拉丁美洲曾为遭受重创而严阵以待。但如今，该地区出口业正迎来前所未有的黄金时期。【原文：Latin America braced for a colossal blow when President Donald Trump’s tariffs upended global trade last year. But it’s never been a better time for the region’s exports.】

item.title: 特朗普放弃对格陵兰岛征收关税后，金价下跌
item.description: 金价下跌，因美国总统特朗普撤回了对欧洲国家加征关税的威胁，并表示已就格陵兰岛达成"未来协议框架"。【原文：Gold fell after US President Donald Trump withdrew a threat to impose tariffs on European nations and said a “framework of a future deal” over Greenland had been agreed.】

item.title: 华尔街大佬们低调行事以避开特朗普的挑衅
item.description:
金融界人士正小心翼翼地周旋，帮助客户在总统第二任期内安然度过，同时避免激怒他。

【原文：

Financiers are doing a careful dance to help clients navigate the president’s second term without provoking his ire

】

item.title: 委内瑞拉将讨论石油改革方案，允许外国钻井公司参与
item.description: 委内瑞拉立法机构定于周四讨论石油改革方案。若该方案得以实施，将打破该国石油行业的国家垄断，允许私营企业开采并销售该国庞大石油储备中的原油。【原文：Venezuela’s legislature on Thursday is set to discuss oil reforms that, if implemented, will unwind the state monopoly of the industry and let private companies produce and sell crude from the country’s vast reserves.】

item.title: 油价持稳，美国推动开发格陵兰岛，供应问题成焦点
item.description: 随着格陵兰岛地缘政治紧张局势降温，油价趋稳，交易员们密切关注从哈萨克斯坦到委内瑞拉的一系列供应问题。【原文：Oil steadied as geopolitical tensions over Greenland cooled, and traders tracked an array of supply issues from Kazakhstan to Venezuela.】

item.title: 韩国经济意外萎缩，整体疲软态势显现
item.description: 2025年第四季度，韩国经济因需求全面萎缩而出现收缩，凸显出当局面临的困境——受韩元汇率波动和金融风险加剧的制约，其刺激经济增长的政策选择受到限制。【原文：South Korea’s economy shrank in the final quarter of 2025 due to a broad pullback in demand, underscoring the challenge for authorities whose policy options to stimulate growth are constrained by a wobbly won and mounting financial risks.】

item.title: 马来西亚料将维持利率不变，因经济增长强劲且通胀率低
item.description: 马来西亚将于周四维持基准利率不变，因经济增长好于预期且通胀率较低，为政策制定者按兵不动提供了缓冲空间。【原文：Malaysia is set to keep its benchmark interest rate unchanged on Thursday, as better-than-expected economic growth coupled with low inflation provide a buffer for policymakers to stand pat.】

item.title: 普京向和平委员会及乌克兰提供在美冻结的俄罗斯资产
item.description: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京表示，在和平条约签署后，他准备动用仍被冻结在美国境内的俄罗斯资产，用于重建战争期间受损的乌克兰地区。【原文：Russia’s President Vladimir Putin said he is ready to commit Russian assets that remain frozen in the US to rebuild Ukrainian regions damaged during the war after a peace treaty is concluded.】

item.title: 亚洲股市有望上涨，特朗普吹捧格陵兰岛交易：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市有望终结连续三日下跌的走势，此前美国总统特朗普表示已就格陵兰问题与北约达成"框架性"协议，推动华尔街股市反弹。【原文：Asian stocks were set to break a three-day losing streak after Wall Street rallied on comments from US President Donald Trump that he had reached a “framework” deal with NATO regarding Greenland.】

item.title: OpenAI首席执行官阿尔特曼会晤中东投资者，筹集500亿美元融资
item.description: 据知情人士透露，OpenAI首席执行官山姆·阿尔特曼近期正与中东地区顶级投资者会晤，为新一轮融资筹备资金，该轮融资总额可能至少达到500亿美元。【原文：OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman has been meeting with top investors in the Middle East to line up funding for a new investment round that could total at least $50 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 巴西化工公司计划在未来数月内公布债务重组方案
item.description: 据知情人士透露，巴西化工巨头布拉斯科公司正着手解决其日益加剧的债务问题，计划于3月前向债权人提交一项庭外重组方案。【原文：Braskem SA is aiming to present an out-of-court restructuring plan to creditors by March as it moves to address its mounting debt woes, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 债券逢低买入者因格陵兰"框架协议"消息获利
item.description: 本周逢低买入美国国债的投资者正收获回报，此前美国总统特朗普放弃了对欧洲国家加征新关税的威胁，此举是其推动收购格陵兰岛计划的一部分。【原文：Investors who bought into this week’s Treasuries selloff are reaping the reward after President Donald Trump backed off his threat to slap new tariffs on European nations as part of his push to acquire Greenland.】

item.title: 风暴引发新西兰多地严重洪灾，多人失踪
item.description: 一场热带风暴引发新西兰北岛大范围严重洪灾，造成人员失踪，迫使居民撤离，并引发直升机救援行动，将被困屋顶的居民救下。【原文：A tropical storm has triggered severe flooding across New Zealand’s North Island, leaving people missing, forcing evacuations and prompting helicopter rescues of residents trapped on rooftops.】

item.title: 伊丽莎白·霍姆斯因欺诈案入狱后请求特朗普提前释放
item.description: 声名狼藉的Theranos公司创始人伊丽莎白·霍姆斯已正式请求唐纳德·特朗普总统将其从监狱中释放，尽管她还有近六年刑期未服完。【原文：Disgraced Theranos Inc. founder Elizabeth Holmes has formally asked President Donald Trump to release her from prison with almost six years left to serve on her term.】

item.title: 黑石以7亿美元估值投资初创企业Applecart
item.description: 营销技术初创公司Applecart在由黑石集团增长股权业务领投的少数股权融资轮中筹集了1亿美元。【原文：Applecart, a marketing technology startup, raised $100 million in a minority funding round led by Blackstone Inc.’s growth equity business.】

item.title: 英伟达获准向中国出口芯片后 美众议院寻求在AI芯片出口问题上拥有更多话语权
item.description: 美国国会距离获得审查向中国销售人工智能芯片的权限又近了一步，此举可能与特朗普政府就允许英伟达公司向世界第二大经济体销售其高性能H200处理器的计划产生分歧。【原文：Congress is one step closer to gaining the authority to review artificial intelligence chip sales to China, a move likely to open a rift with the Trump administration over plans to let Nvidia Corp. sell its powerful H200 processors to the world’s second largest economy.】

item.title: 法院暂缓禁令后，TikTok在加拿大获得缓刑
item.description: 此前要求TikTok在加拿大逐步停止运营的命令已被法官搁置，因此该平台目前仍可继续运营其在加拿大的子公司。【原文：TikTok will be able to continue operating its subsidiary in Canada for now, after a previous order for it to wind down its operations in the country was shelved by a judge.】

item.title: 人工智能初创企业SambaNova在与英特尔的谈判陷入僵局后，寻求最高5亿美元融资
item.description: 知情人士透露，人工智能初创企业SambaNova Systems Inc.正考虑筹集高达5亿美元的资金，此前该公司与英特尔公司（Intel Corp.）的收购谈判陷入停滞。【原文：Artificial intelligence startup SambaNova Systems Inc. is considering raising up to $500 million after talks to sell to Intel Corp. stalled, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 德意志交易所达成62亿美元收购Allfunds协议
item.description: 德意志交易所集团同意以约53亿欧元（62亿美元）的现金和股票收购欧洲基金分销平台Allfunds集团。【原文：Deutsche Boerse AG agreed to acquire European fund distribution platform Allfunds Group Plc for about €5.3 billion ($6.2 billion) in cash and stock.】

item.title: 一场极不一致的通胀预测
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读本期通讯，这里汇集了Odd Lots世界每日的精彩内容。有时是我们——乔·韦森塔尔和特蕾西·阿洛威——为您解读市场、金融与经济领域的最新动态；有时则是我们专家嘉宾和信息源网络的贡献。无论内容如何，我们保证始终引人入胜。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 中国副总理在达沃斯会见戴蒙、库克、达利欧等首席执行官
item.description: 据知情人士透露，中国国务院副总理何立峰在达沃斯世界经济论坛期间会见了多位全球企业高管——在贸易和金融碎片化引发担忧之际，此举彰显了中国持续拓展国际合作的决心。【原文：China’s Vice Premier He Lifeng met with a coterie of top global executives at the World Economic Forum in Davos, according to a person familiar with the matter — maintaining his nation’s international outreach amid fears of trade and financial fragmentation.】

item.title: 苹果将重塑Siri为内置于iPhone和Mac的聊天机器人以抗衡OpenAI
item.description: 苹果公司计划在今年晚些时候对Siri进行全面升级，将其打造为公司首款人工智能聊天机器人，从而推动这家iPhone制造商加入由OpenAI和谷歌主导的生成式人工智能竞赛。【原文：Apple Inc. plans to revamp Siri later this year by turning the digital assistant into the company’s first artificial intelligence chatbot, thrusting the iPhone maker into a generative AI race dominated by OpenAI and Google.】

item.title: 60亿美元国债ETF成为代币化金融试验场
item.description: 华尔街受监管最严格的资产类别之一正被纳入数字金融的轨道。【原文：One of Wall Street’s most regulated asset classes is being pulled into the orbit of digital finance.】

item.title: 伊顿考虑出售或剥离其价值50亿美元的汽车业务部门
item.description: 知情人士透露，伊顿公司正考虑对其汽车业务部门进行战略调整。这家电气设备制造商在新任首席执行官领导下，正致力于聚焦高增长业务领域。【原文：Eaton Corp. is considering strategic options for its vehicle unit, people familiar with the matter said, as the electrical equipment maker looks to focus on high-growth businesses under its new chief executive officer.】

item.title: Anthropic营收年化率突破90亿美元，风投机构争相注资
item.description:
Iconiq、Lightspeed和Menlo Ventures即将加入该初创企业的新一轮融资，估值达3500亿美元。

【原文：

Iconiq, Lightspeed and Menlo Ventures are set to join the startup’s new funding round at a $350 billion valuation. 

】

item.title: 阿根廷中期选举后经济萎缩幅度超预期
item.description: 阿根廷经济在11月连续第二个月萎缩，此前该国经历了一场关键的中期选举，导致市场出现急剧抛售。【原文：Argentina’s economy contracted for a second consecutive month in November on the heels of a crunch midterm election that had precipitated a sharp market selloff.】
